results.title: Chocolat [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Claire Denis, Gerald Crosnier, Alain Belmondo, La Sept, Cerito Films and Oceania Produzioni Internazionali Cinematografiche
results.brief_description: Memories of a childhood in a remote part of the French Cameroons provides the basis for this subtle, partly autobiographical, portrait of a colonial society. France (a surrogate for the filmmaker), revisiting the Cameroons, flashes back to scenes of her youth when her father was a French colonial official. The precarious equilibrium of their household (the mother is attracted to a young black servant) is disturbed by the sudden arrival of a group of outsiders, both European and African, after the forced landing of their plane nearby. The sharpness of the observation and the performances - each of the outsiders represents a different perspective on Africa - prevents the film from sliding into easy nostalgia for a time and way of life long since past. Cast: Isaach de Bankole, Giulia Boschi, Francois Cluzet, Jean-Claude Adelin. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Madadayo
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Gihei Kogure, Yasuyoshi Tokuma, Tokuma Shoten, Kurosawa Productions, Dentsu and Daiei Motion Picture Company
results.brief_description: The final film of Akira Kurosawa was not universally praised by critics and was in fact deemed sentimental and at times even mawkish. Nevertheless the striking cinematography, wonderful setting and gently observed Japanese customs and rituals make it a film worthy of consideration. “Madadayo” is the story of the educator and literary figure Hyakken Uchida, who was a hero of Kurosawa’s. The film follows Uchida’s life from his retirement at sixty and shows that he was a committed teacher adored by his students for his humour and wisdom. In the year 1943 Uchida buys a house in Tokyo, settles down with his wife and determines to work on his novel. But their home is destroyed in an Allied raid and the couple are forced to relocate to more humble surrounds. Former loyal students visit Uchida annually, assisting him in times of need and offering unfailing support. Vignettes display the progress of these relationships, in particular through birthday parties thrown in his honour each year, where the students revel in teasing him about death - to which he always replies that he is not ready yet. A spirited and thoughtful bio-pic, brimming with cultural nuances and an appealing cast including Tatsuo Matsumura, Kyoko Kagawa, Hisashi Igawa, Joji Tokoro, Masayuki Yui, Akira Terao, Asei Kobayashi, Takeshi Kusaka.

results.title: Divided we fall = Musime si pomahat [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jan Hrebejk, Ondrej Trojan, Pavel Pavel Borovan, Total HelpArt and Czech Television Production
results.brief_description: Beginning in 1937, and taking us through to the end of World War II, “Divided we fall” follows the fate of three men who were all colleagues when the war began. David Wiener (Csongor Kassai) is the son of a Jewish family who own the business in which Josef (Bolek Polivka) and Horst (Jaroslav Dusek) work. The Wieners are taken to the death camps of Poland but David manages to escape and find his way back to his Czech home. He finds a population cowered into subservience and suspicion from the years of Nazi occupation. But the childless Josef, and his wife, Marie (Anna Siskova), take in the fugitive David and hide him in their pantry. Horst, whose social standing has increased due to his collaboration with the Germans, is a constant visitor at Josef and Marie’s, and their attempts to hide David from him bring a rich vein of humour to the film. And then, as if a miracle, Marie falls pregnant! The strength of “Divided we fall” is that in the midst of modern European history’s darkest tragedies, the director Jan Hrebejk, is able to create a humane comedy in which questions of loyalty and forgiveness loom much larger than desires for retribution and revenge. There is a revisionism undoubtedly at work in the film: the Resistance is purged of Communism and the Czechs are always the unwilling dupes of the Germans. But for the bumbling, foolish humans at the centre of “Divided we fall”, politics is never a consideration. Universalism and humanism are the driving forces behind the ethics of this film. Nominated for Best Foreign Language Oscar at the 2001 Academy Awards. Winner of the Grand Prix at the 2001 Sydney Film Festival.

results.title: The Insider [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Michael Mann, Eric Roth, Spyglass Entertainment and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: From the opening scene, “The Insider” is a gripping and exhilarating thriller that investigates the corruption of journalist ethics. Russell Crowe gives an effective performance playing against type as Jeffrey Wigand, a paunchy middle-aged business man working for the tobacco industry who decides to blow the whistle on his colleagues’ attempts to hide the health risks associated with smoking. Al Pacino is the television journalist who takes on Jeffrey’s case but who finds that his own media executives refuse to support him. Based on the true story of when a tobacco industry whistleblower approached the US “Sixty Minutes” program, “The Insider” presents a cynical and disturbing case for how the increasing corporatisation of mass media leads to a denigration of the fifth estate’s objectivity and ethics. Michael Mann’s direction in this film is a critical leap for his own artistic career and the purpose and power of his vision is reflected in the high calibre of the support he receives from his cast and crew. The original music score is by Lisa Gerrard and Peter Bourke who are part of the musical group, Dead Can Dance. Cast also includes Christopher Plummer, Gina Gershon, Debi Mazer, Lindsay Crouse, Rip Torn and Philip Baker Hall.

results.title: Buffalo 66
results.creator_credit: Vincent Gallo, Chris Hanley and Cinepix Film Properties
results.brief_description: Vincent Gallo made his directorial debut with this comedy drama about convict, Billy Brown, who is released from prison after serving a five year sentence for a crime he did not commit. Bitter and prone to violence, Billy is determined to convince his dysfunctional parents that he has been leading a respectable life doing top-secret CIA work. To give his story credibility, he impulsively kidnaps Layla from a tap-dancing class, forcing her to pose as his wife when he returns home for a visit. Layla strangely takes to the role with enthusiasm and remains with Billy even after the parental visit. Cast includes: Vincent Gallo, Christina Ricci, Anjelica Huston, Ben Gazzara, Kevin Corrigan, Mickey Rourke, Rosanna Arquette and Jan-Michael Vincent.

results.title: Lumiere and company
results.creator_credit: Fabienne Servan-Schreiber, Neal Edelstein, Soren Staermose AB, Studio Canal+, La Sept-Arte, Igeldo Komunikazioa and Cineteve
results.brief_description:
These are the rules: No post editing; no synchronous sound; no more than three takes. The facts: only 52 seconds of film using an original restored 35mm Lumiere camera. 40 filmmakers from around the world partake in one of the most fascinating and enlightening cinematic experiments in film history, to commemorate the centennial of the Lumiere Brothers’ first motion picture. “From slapstick comedy to political propaganda, documentary realism to costume drama, the world is fleetingly captured once again. But the lens of the contemporary beholders has seen a century the Lumiere brothers could scarcely have imagined. Watching the directors it is hard to decide which side of the camera provides the greater entertainment! Who cranks the handle themselves or who insists on a full technical crew; who conquers, or cracks under the constraints is fascinating and just as illuminating as the succinct sensations they create.” - Amree Hewitt. 45th Melbourne International Film Festival, 1996.

results.title: The Year my voice broke
results.creator_credit: John Duigan, George Miller, Doug Mitchell, Terry Hayes, Kennedy Miller Productions and Avenue Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in the early sixties in the Tablelands of New South Wales, “The Year my voice broke” is an evocation of adolescence in a pre-multicultural, rigidly conservative rural Australia. Noah Taylor is Danny, an intelligent but awkward teenage boy who dreams of fame as a musician or as a poet. Leone Carmen is Freya, his best friend, who is adopted by a local family and whose forthright rebellious behaviour leads to a reputation as the town “slut”. Danny and Freya’s friendship becomes strained when she falls for the local “thug”, Trevor, played by Ben Mendelsohn. When Freya finds herself pregnant to Trevor, the local township is united in their condemnation of her. It is the bond between Danny, Freya, Trevor and the ghost of the town’s past which ultimately lead to both tragedy, but also the chance of escape from the boredom and social constraints of small-town life. The acting by the three leads is exemplary. The ravishing cinematography is by Geoff Burton. The script and direction by John Duigan is possibly his finest work. In its emotional purity, in its alternate tender and harsh remembrance of mid-century Australia, and in its poetically simple but devastating depiction of both tragedy and freedom, “The Year my voice broke” is internationally acknowledged as one of the finest film works to have emerged from this country.

results.description: Set in the early sixties in the Tablelands of New South Wales, “The Year my voice broke” is an evocation of adolescence in a pre-multicultural, rigidly conservative rural Australia. Noah Taylor is Danny, an intelligent but awkward teenage boy who dreams of fame as a musician or as a poet. Leone Carmen is Freya, his best friend, who is adopted by a local family and whose forthright rebellious behaviour leads to a reputation as the town “slut”. Danny and Freya’s friendship becomes strained when she falls for the local “thug”, Trevor, played by Ben Mendelsohn. When Freya finds herself pregnant to Trevor, the local township is united in their condemnation of her. It is the bond between Danny, Freya, Trevor and the ghost of the town’s past which ultimately lead to both tragedy, but also the chance of escape from the boredom and social constraints of small-town life. results.title: American history X (D)
results.creator_credit: Tony Kaye, John Morriseey, Turman-Morrissey Company and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Rage vented as racism. Derek Vinyard (Edward Norton) seeks retribution for his father’s murder, and through his distorted logic and his charismatic leadership qualities, commands a growing army of skinheads at Venice Beach, California. Nobody looks up to Derek as much as his younger brother Danny (Edward Furlong), despite the efforts of his mother and teacher to persuade him otherwise. What should have been a case of self-defence, Derek violently attacks and murders an African American attempting to break into his car. After spending 3 years in prison, everyone awaits his return; his gang, his violent girlfriend and his younger brother. But Derek no longer shares the same views he once embraced as a badge of honour. What follows is a race to save his Danny and his family from the violence he’d brought down on so many others. Script by David McKenna.

results.title: Bitter moon = Lunes de fiel
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Timothy Burrill Productions, R P Productions, Canal+ and Les Films Alain Sarde
results.brief_description: This dark-humored comedy drama explores perverse sexual obsession in a marriage based on mutual hatred. While on a luxury cruise to Istanbul a repressed English couple, Nigel and Fiona, (played by Hugh Grant and Kristin Scott-Thomas) meet a crippled American writer and his beautiful French wife. As the American entertains Nigel with elaborate accounts of the sexual power games he and his wife play (related in lengthy flashbacks), the English couple’s curiosity is aroused. Gradually they become drawn into their twisted and ultimately destructive relationship as unwitting observers and participants in a tragedy with the most extraordinary outcome. Cast also includes Peter Coyote and Emmanuelle Seigner.

results.title: Office killer
results.creator_credit: Cindy Sherman, Pamela Koffler, Christine Vachon and Artfear Productions
results.brief_description: Usually known for her extensive career in photography spanning over 20 years, Cindy Sherman directs her first feature film and brings to life the characters that she has depicted within her photography. Dorine (Kane) is the company doormat, seemingly obliging and mild mannered until one day she accidentally electrocutes a fellow worker, who happens to be her most obnoxious opponent. The unhinged Dorine continues her killing spree believing that all can be friends when dead. Her antics verge on discovery when the bitchy co-worker played by Molly Ringwald suspects that all is not okay. Following in the b-grade genre of film-making, Sherman delights with an excess of gory special effects. Cast also includes: Jeanne Tripplehorn.
